lines.text: Enter Corporal NYM and Lieutenant BARDOLPH

lines.speaker: bardolph
lines.text: Well met, Corporal Nym.

lines.speaker: nym
lines.text: Good morrow, Lieutenant Bardolph.

lines.speaker: bardolph
lines.text: What, are Ancient Pistol and you friends yet

lines.speaker: nym
lines.text: For my part, I care not: I say little but when time shall serve, there shall be smiles but that shall be as it may. I dare not fight but I will wink and hold out mine iron: it is a simple one but what though it will toast cheese, and it will endure cold as another mans sword will: and theres an end.

lines.speaker: bardolph
lines.text: I will bestow a breakfast to make you friends and well be all three sworn brothers to France: let it be so, good Corporal Nym.

lines.speaker: nym
lines.text: Faith, I will live so long as I may, thats the certain of it and when I cannot live any longer, I will do as I may: that is my rest, that is the rendezvous of it.

lines.speaker: bardolph
lines.text: It is certain, corporal, that he is married to Nell Quickly: and certainly she did you wrong for you were trothplight to her.

lines.speaker: nym
lines.text: I cannot tell: things must be as they may: men may sleep, and they may have their throats about them at that time and some say knives have edges. It must be as it may: though patience be a tired mare, yet she will plod. There must be conclusions. Well, I cannot tell.
Enter PISTOL and Hostess

lines.speaker: bardolph
lines.text: Here comes Ancient Pistol and his wife: good corporal, be patient here. How now, mine host Pistol!

lines.speaker: pistol
lines.text: Base tike, callst thou me host Now, by this hand, I swear, I scorn the term Nor shall my Nell keep lodgers.

lines.speaker: hostess
lines.text: No, by my troth, not long for we cannot lodge and board a dozen or fourteen gentlewomen that live honestly by the prick of their needles, but it will be thought we keep a bawdy house straight. O well a day, Lady, if he be not drawn now! we shall see wilful adultery and murder committed.
NYM and PISTOL draw

lines.speaker: bardolph
lines.text: Good lieutenant! good corporal! offer nothing here.

lines.speaker: nym
lines.text: Pish!

lines.speaker: pistol
lines.text: Pish for thee, Iceland dog! thou prickeard cur of Iceland!

lines.speaker: hostess
lines.text: Good Corporal Nym, show thy valour, and put up your sword.

lines.speaker: nym
lines.text: Will you shog off I would have you solus.

lines.speaker: pistol
lines.text: Solus, egregious dog O viper vile! The solus in thy most mervailous face The solus in thy teeth, and in thy throat, And in thy hateful lungs, yea, in thy maw, perdy, And, which is worse, within thy nasty mouth! I do retort the solus in thy bowels For I can take, and Pistols cock is up, And flashing fire will follow.

lines.speaker: nym
lines.text: I am not Barbason you cannot conjure me. I have an humour to knock you indifferently well. If you grow foul with me, Pistol, I will scour you with my rapier, as I may, in fair terms: if you would walk off, I would prick your guts a little, in good terms, as I may: and thats the humour of it.

lines.speaker: pistol
lines.text: O braggart vile and damned furious wight! The grave doth gape, and doting death is near Therefore exhale.

lines.speaker: bardolph
lines.text: Hear me, hear me what I say: he that strikes the first stroke, Ill run him up to the hilts, as I am a soldier.
Draws

lines.speaker: pistol
lines.text: An oath of mickle might and fury shall abate. Give me thy fist, thy forefoot to me give: Thy spirits are most tall.

lines.speaker: nym
lines.text: I will cut thy throat, one time or other, in fair terms: that is the humour of it.

lines.speaker: pistol
lines.text: Couple a gorge! That is the word. I thee defy again. O hound of Crete, thinkst thou my spouse to get No to the spital go, And from the powdering tub of infamy Fetch forth the lazar kite of Cressids kind, Doll Tearsheet she by name, and her espouse: I have, and I will hold, the quondam Quickly For the only she andpauca, theres enough. Go to.
Enter the Boy

lines.speaker: boy
lines.text: Mine host Pistol, you must come to my master, and you, hostess: he is very sick, and would to bed. Good Bardolph, put thy face between his sheets, and do the office of a warmingpan. Faith, hes very ill.

lines.speaker: bardolph
lines.text: Away, you rogue!

lines.speaker: hostess
lines.text: By my troth, hell yield the crow a pudding one of these days. The king has killed his heart. Good husband, come home presently.
Exeunt Hostess and Boy

lines.speaker: bardolph
lines.text: Come, shall I make you two friends We must to France together: why the devil should we keep knives to cut one anothers throats

lines.speaker: pistol
lines.text: Let floods oerswell, and fiends for food howl on!

lines.speaker: nym
lines.text: Youll pay me the eight shillings I won of you at betting

lines.speaker: pistol
lines.text: Base is the slave that pays.

lines.speaker: nym
lines.text: That now I will have: thats the humour of it.

lines.speaker: pistol
lines.text: As manhood shall compound: push home.
They draw

lines.speaker: bardolph
lines.text: By this sword, he that makes the first thrust, Ill kill him by this sword, I will.

lines.speaker: pistol
lines.text: Sword is an oath, and oaths must have their course.

lines.speaker: bardolph
lines.text: Corporal Nym, an thou wilt be friends, be friends: an thou wilt not, why, then, be enemies with me too. Prithee, put up.

lines.speaker: nym
lines.text: I shall have my eight shillings I won of you at betting

lines.speaker: pistol
lines.text: A noble shalt thou have, and present pay And liquor likewise will I give to thee, And friendship shall combine, and brotherhood: Ill live by Nym, and Nym shall live by me Is not this just for I shall sutler be Unto the camp, and profits will accrue. Give me thy hand.

lines.speaker: nym
lines.text: I shall have my noble

lines.speaker: pistol
lines.text: In cash most justly paid.

lines.speaker: nym
lines.text: Well, then, thats the humour oft.
Reenter Hostess

lines.speaker: hostess
lines.text: As ever you came of women, come in quickly to Sir John. Ah, poor heart! he is so shaked of a burning quotidian tertian, that it is most lamentable to behold. Sweet men, come to him.

lines.speaker: nym
lines.text: The king hath run bad humours on the knight thats the even of it.

lines.speaker: pistol
lines.text: Nym, thou hast spoke the right His heart is fracted and corroborate.

lines.speaker: nym
lines.text: The king is a good king: but it must be as it may he passes some humours and careers.

lines.speaker: pistol
lines.text: Let us condole the knight for, lambkins we will live.
